author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 3
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 3

segments.pli: 11. Sambodhavagga
segments.en: 11. Awakening

segments.pli: 109. Arakkhitasutta
segments.en: 109. Unprotected

segments.pli: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho anāthapiṇḍikaṃ gahapatiṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:

segments.pli: “citte, gahapati, arakkhite kāyakammampi arakkhitaṃ hoti, vacīkammampi arakkhitaṃ hoti, manokammampi arakkhitaṃ hoti.
segments.en: “Householder, when the mind is unprotected, deeds of body, speech, and mind are unprotected.

segments.pli: Tassa arakkhitakāyakammantassa arakkhitavacīkammantassa arakkhitamanokammantassa kāyakammampi avassutaṃ hoti, vacīkammampi avassutaṃ hoti, manokammampi avassutaṃ hoti.
segments.en: When deeds are unprotected, they become corrupted.

segments.pli: Tassa avassutakāyakammantassa avassutavacīkammantassa avassutamanokammantassa kāyakammampi pūtikaṃ hoti, vacīkammampi pūtikaṃ hoti, manokammampi pūtikaṃ hoti.
segments.en: When deeds are corrupted, they become rotten.

segments.pli: Tassa pūtikāyakammantassa pūtivacīkammantassa pūtimanokammantassa na bhaddakaṃ maraṇaṃ hoti, na bhaddikā kālakiriyā.
segments.en: Someone whose deeds of body, speech, and mind are rotten will not have a good death.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, gahapati, kūṭāgāre ducchanne kūṭampi arakkhitaṃ hoti, gopānasiyopi arakkhitā honti, bhittipi arakkhitā hoti;
segments.en: It’s like a bungalow with a bad roof. The roof peak, rafters, and walls are unprotected.

segments.pli: kūṭampi avassutaṃ hoti, gopānasiyopi avassutā honti, bhittipi avassutā hoti;
segments.en: They get soaked,

segments.pli: kūṭampi pūtikaṃ hoti, gopānasiyopi pūtikā honti, bhittipi pūtikā hoti.
segments.en: and become rotten.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, gahapati, citte arakkhite kāyakammampi arakkhitaṃ hoti, vacīkammampi arakkhitaṃ hoti, manokammampi arakkhitaṃ hoti.
segments.en: In the same way, when the mind is unprotected, bodily, verbal, and mental deeds are unprotected. …

segments.pli: Tassa arakkhitakāyakammantassa arakkhitavacīkammantassa arakkhitamanokammantassa kāyakammampi avassutaṃ hoti, vacīkammampi avassutaṃ hoti, manokammampi avassutaṃ hoti.
Tassa avassutakāyakammantassa avassutavacīkammantassa avassutamanokammantassa kāyakammampi pūtikaṃ hoti, vacīkammampi pūtikaṃ hoti, manokammampi pūtikaṃ hoti.
Tassa pūtikāyakammantassa pūtivacīkammantassa pūtimanokammantassa na bhaddakaṃ maraṇaṃ hoti, na bhaddikā kālakiriyā.
segments.en: Someone whose deeds of body, speech, and mind are rotten will not have a good death.

segments.pli: Citte, gahapati, rakkhite kāyakammampi rakkhitaṃ hoti, vacīkammampi rakkhitaṃ hoti, manokammampi rakkhitaṃ hoti.
segments.en: When the mind is protected, bodily, verbal, and mental deeds are protected.

segments.pli: Tassa rakkhitakāyakammantassa rakkhitavacīkammantassa rakkhitamanokammantassa kāyakammampi anavassutaṃ hoti, vacīkammampi anavassutaṃ hoti, manokammampi anavassutaṃ hoti.
segments.en: When deeds are protected, they don’t become corrupted.

segments.pli: Tassa anavassutakāyakammantassa anavassutavacīkammantassa anavassutamanokammantassa kāyakammampi apūtikaṃ hoti, vacīkammampi apūtikaṃ hoti, manokammampi apūtikaṃ hoti.
segments.en: When deeds aren’t corrupted, they don’t become rotten.

segments.pli: Tassa apūtikāyakammantassa apūtivacīkammantassa apūtimanokammantassa bhaddakaṃ maraṇaṃ hoti, bhaddikā kālakiriyā.
segments.en: Someone whose deeds of body, speech, and mind aren’t rotten will have a good death.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, gahapati, kūṭāgāre succhanne kūṭampi rakkhitaṃ hoti, gopānasiyopi rakkhitā honti, bhittipi rakkhitā hoti;
segments.en: It’s like a bungalow with a good roof. The roof peak, rafters, and walls are protected.

segments.pli: kūṭampi anavassutaṃ hoti, gopānasiyopi anavassutā honti, bhittipi anavassutā hoti;
segments.en: They don’t get soaked,

segments.pli: kūṭampi apūtikaṃ hoti, gopānasiyopi apūtikā honti, bhittipi apūtikā hoti.
segments.en: and they don’t become rotten.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, gahapati, citte rakkhite kāyakammampi rakkhitaṃ hoti, vacīkammampi rakkhitaṃ hoti, manokammampi rakkhitaṃ hoti.
segments.en: In the same way, when the mind is protected, bodily, verbal, and mental deeds are protected. …

segments.pli: Tassa rakkhitakāyakammantassa rakkhitavacīkammantassa rakkhitamanokammantassa kāyakammampi anavassutaṃ hoti, vacīkammampi anavassutaṃ hoti, manokammampi anavassutaṃ hoti.
Tassa anavassutakāyakammantassa anavassutavacīkammantassa anavassutamanokammantassa kāyakammampi apūtikaṃ hoti, vacīkammampi apūtikaṃ hoti, manokammampi apūtikaṃ hoti.
Tassa apūtikāyakammantassa apūtivacīkammantassa apūtimanokammantassa bhaddakaṃ maraṇaṃ hoti, bhaddikā kālakiriyā”ti.
segments.en: Someone whose deeds of body, speech, and mind aren’t rotten will have a good death.”

segments.pli: Sattamaṃ.

sections.title: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika went up to the Buddha,…

suttaplex.blurb: Protecting your mind is like protecting a house.
